website_summaries.verdict: The 8-inch jaws are the widest among our top five contenders. Decent midrange model has the advantages of cast iron, durability and tensile strength, but also some of its disadvantages (brittleness in cold, rust issues).
pros: 30,000 PSI cast-iron construction is durable enough for welding and other heavy-duty jobs
Replaceable serrated steel jaws hold projects tightly in place
Flat steel anvil for bending and shaping metal
cons: Swivel angle is limited to 120 degrees
Some user concerns about heavy preservative grease layer and sharp edges

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my workbench
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my home workbench! This vice is very heavy and seems well built. I have had no issues with it at all. As with must vices its an easy install. Love the dark color of this one as well opposed to bright red and blue ones ... not something I would ever care about in a regular shop but wanted one that was aesthetically pleasing AND could get the job done. I use this for building guns. It's def. and overkill for that but better to have it then to have one thats too small.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Solid medium-duty vise, especially for the price.  Handles 75%+ of all the metal-holding needs I have.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, especially for the price. I managed to sheer off the screws holding one of the jaw faces by whaling on a 26-year-old driveshaft u-joint with a 2lb sledge. Tekton and I agreed that this use probably exceeded the capacity of this unit, but they were responsive and offered helpful advice on fixing it. I had it back in service the next day, and with the understanding that I probably also need a bigger vise for drivetrain and suspension work I think it will last me a long time doing 75% of what I need a vise for.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bench vise. I'm using it for home/garage work and it's very sturdy. I'm not a handy person by any means and this might not be the right tool for someone looking to do industrial work all day long, I don't think this vise is meant for that, but it's more than enough for typical house/garage work. For this price point, you can't be wrong. I presume this vise will still be here long time after I'm gone.
customer_reviews.author: Screamer

customer_reviews.title: Just get this already and stop your endless search
customer_reviews.text: Ok so first off, if you're looking for a vise for diy gun projects, this thing will work amazingly. Everything else? That too. It has a nice flat anvil section perfect for a foot or two when trying to pry off seriously overtorqued barrel nuts. The screw that drives the in and out motion of the jaw also seems pretty sturdy as goes for the massive bar used to turn it. Overall, definitely worth the price. Looking for a heavy duty vise that works bolted or loose... this is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: kyle wray

customer_reviews.title: NOT MADE IN USA!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice vise. However it got low ratings because I ordered a vise 'Made in America's. The damn thing is made in China. The company that sold it was based in Michigan. Not entirely happy. Will not urge people to buy from a company who's products pop up as ' Made in America's but their stuff is proudly stamped as CHINA. Amazon is partially at fault for this as they should verify the actual place of manufacture. Would have paid more to keep Americans busy manufacturing. Red CHINA doesn't need more of our money..
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. kloppel

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome Vise for the money
customer_reviews.text: See Headline. This is a seriously excellent vise. In terms of quality easily beats out the Harbor Freight or Home depot special while being extremely reasonably priced. Barely any play in the slide, nice big platen in the back, smooth swivel action. I felt bad for UPS for having to deliver something so heavy but to their credit came in perfect shape. We live in an age where you can order a massive vise and have it on your doorstep in a couple days. Let that one sink in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Good vise, horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a solid vice. VERY heavy. Packaging/shipping however is GARBAGE. This package in particular was clearly through the ringer. Opened it up and yup, scratches and chips all over, as well as a spot on the jaw that had been ground down (as if dragged against course concrete) vise needed a very thorough cleaning as well as all of the oil was holding sand/grit and you could FEEL the courseness/grit when moving the vice in/out. Cleaned it well and have a well working albeit uglier than it should have been vise.
customer_reviews.author: P Foster

customer_reviews.title: Tough and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought different types of tools from this company and I stay impressed with the quality of work the put out eveytime I buy something from them. This bench vise is simple, robust, and clean. I had to change some bearings and ball joints from my car and man this thing held up when I placed the car knuckles on it! Especially taking out one of my badly damaged ball joints that was suck in there. Be advised if you install it outside make sure to cover it! Mines been outside for about a month with no signs of rust.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: For a 4" vise it's really pretty well designed and works very good. I just didn't need much more for around the house useage.
customer_reviews.text: My garage 4" vise of 35 years finally broke on me. Purchased a new one and bang it broke also. This one seems to be hanging in there. I'll let you know in 35 years how well it holds up for me (maybe not).
customer_reviews.author: S. Savage

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It worked until it didn't...It was bought in Feb 2020 and made it a whole 3 months, if even. It was used for typical household/garage jobs. It broke while trying to shape a piece of 1⁄4 metal tubing that is pictured in my review. Save your money and buy a better quality vice
customer_reviews.author: Angela B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hobby shop vise.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for making jewelry, and other small projects. It has a nice finish and is very tight and precise. The anvil on the back is really handy. I was worried it would be sloppy, but the tension spring holds the handle in any position with nothing in the jaws. I'm not sure how it would hold up to heavy use, automotive etc but for hobby and detail work it has been awesome so far. I'll update my review if anything changes but I'm pretty impressed with this little vise.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not hollow!
customer_reviews.text: Some vises are hollow now, although they look normal. This one is heavy and i think it is solid. It works perfectly. I have used it for several jobs now and am happy with my purchase. The finish was good too. I mounted it on a piece of wood and clamp that in my jaw horse. Works great if you don't have a workbench anymore. (hurricane).
customer_reviews.author: Pcola Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a vise I could mount on an outside work bench to sharpen lawn mower blades and chainsaw, etc. I do cover it so as not to rust. Seems of good quality and according to the warranty and several reviews this vise is warranted for life under normal circumstances. I do not recommend using a steel pipe for tightening vise or beat on jaws. Nothing is going to holdup to abuse! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dan the man

customer_reviews.title: Poor casting!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bench vise one year ago. Used it a few times on small metal pieces for cutting. I put a piece of Plastic between the jaws to bend and the front jaw snapped right off just missing my foot. I have used alot of vises for some heavy metal fabricating and have never has a vise break like that. That is very poor casting to say the least. If your looking for a 4 inch vise, walk away from this one pure junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mark s.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice for Homeowner Use
customer_reviews.text: This vise is an excellent all-around choice for homeowner use. It clamps tightly and evenly and seems to be well finished for a vise that costs less than $50. Despite Tekton's photo here on Amazon depicting a max opening of 3" for the 54004, it actually opens to a maximum of 4". I believe this is the same vise as the Yost BV-4 and the Wilton 11104, though with a different paint job and a very slightly different swivel base. I chose the Tekton over the others because they appear to offer better warranty support/customer service through their website should anything ever go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great light duty vise for the bench.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light duty vise for the average (or slightly more) shop or garage. I've used this vise to hold all kinds of materials and even made some soft jaws on my 3D printer which have made it even more useful. The main screw isn't sloppy and the handle turns with the expected amount of force. The vise needed a bit of brake cleaner to take-down the shipping grease, but once cleaned up it looks terrific (remember to re-lubricate the functional parts).
customer_reviews.author: JTenkely

customer_reviews.title: Found this one comparable to Best 4" at Harbor Freight
customer_reviews.text: Broke my old 4" with 1/2 drive, 2' breaker bar and too much muscle. Found this one comparable to Best 4" at Harbor Freight. Good quality vice, good fit and finish, drive screw and machined sufaces are of higher precision. Had very little cosmoline (common complaint) to remove. Discard the hole pattern and back drill from the vice base. Yes! The holes are for 5/16 bolts and the pattern is 1/2 hole off. Would be a full 6 stars with pattern and hole size corrections.Ready for another bout with breaker bar and rusty bolt removal
customer_reviews.author: Lanwmowerman

customer_reviews.title: They have EXCELLENT customer service and great quality tools
customer_reviews.text: I got this vise due to my previous experience with Tekton. They have EXCELLENT customer service and great quality tools. This particular vise is of good quality. I didn't find anything off with the casting. However, it calls for 3/8" mounting bolts...this is wrong. Mine took 5/16", which in itself is not a big deal, but I had to go back to the hardware store and exchange the bolts I bought before this arrived.
customer_reviews.author: PCTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Kinda Tiny
customer_reviews.text: Not the vise your father and grandfather had, as this one is "craft size". You could hold a 2x4 in it, but not much more. Feels sturdy and installation was easy (keep in mind no bolts/screws come with it). I would buy again, but still long for a full size one (even though I do not want to spend that much).
customer_reviews.author: Texas Knight

customer_reviews.title: Holds its own!
customer_reviews.text: This swivel bench vise is great. I was looking at getting one for my firearm hobby. When building them, this is just what I needed. Very strong and firm. I mounted it to a 2x4 and use it as a portable vise. (Very nifty). I haven’t had any issues with it thus far and would have to recommend it to all those who are looking for a good vise that holds its own. (No pun intended)
customer_reviews.author: Pizza face

customer_reviews.title: A tad small but solid
customer_reviews.text: If your a LIGHT user, this will work probably for you. It is fairly small so it is good if you have limited work space in your garage esp if your a DIY person. If your a moderate user, esp using this for automotive, get a larger vise as this is just not big enough to handle some of the suspension parts. I used this to flatten some small metal brackets, although it works fine, a bigger, larger and heavier vise would have made things alot easier for me. I ended up returning this vise and picked up a 5 1/2 Yost vise for my particular needs.
customer_reviews.author: e-rock

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good vise
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the experiences of some other reviewers, the vise came with no thick coating of oil OR sharp edges. Very good home garage vise. Much sturdier with better action than the $50 4 inch Wilton. Very compact. Good finish. Tightens nicely. Three 1/4 inch bolts hold it firmly to the bench. Surprisingly good vise. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.....
customer_reviews.text: Most important thing, the neck, or spine, etc. whatever it's called is solid. NEVER buy a vice where you see the screw parts between the two major parts, I've had so many break that were made like that. Yes, there are cheaper ones out there, but remember, you get what you pay for and so far, so good on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Blaydese

customer_reviews.title: Burly little thing
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a vise that one of our techs literally CRACKED trying to thread titanium rod using a high end Japanese split die which somehow didn't crack (that's another review for another time lol) and this Tekton one, though smaller, already seems like a sturdier tool. The alignment and adjustment are both good. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel MackintoshTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a bunch of bench vises as this purchase was my first one. This has been perfect. It even comes with a mounting diagram/template but DOUBLECHECK before drilling. The holes were slightly off. I also had to dremel the inside slightly for the recommended bolts to fit. Once it's mounted it works great. The swivel function has been very beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review : The good and the bad.
customer_reviews.text: So At first the vise seemed fine. After a few uses the 4 screws holding the grip plates on started working themselves loose. I had to tighten them every single time I used the vise. I contacted the company and after much back and forth, they offered a solution which was better than I had expected. That is the only problem I have had with it and for the price, it is ok. As far as the company, they stand behind the product and were willing to make me happy so would be willing to try other tools from them just for that reason alone.
customer_reviews.author: TheCommonMan

customer_reviews.title: awesomely huge
customer_reviews.text: So I bought the 8inch vise which in my mind was a decent size but when it arrived, holy ship wreck the thing is the godzilla of vises!!! absolutely huge !!! Don’t get me wrong its not a bad thing, I was just expecting something mediocre size. I absolutely love it and will adjust to the huge size
customer_reviews.author: Lostcause06

customer_reviews.title: Tekton bench vise, affordable high quality tool for your DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: aside from the high rate of satisfaction from previous buyers, i found the Tekton bench vise to be robustly constructed, materials used seemed to be of high quality, weight is just right for this kind of tool, Amazon advertised this product as used but almost new in its original box (but damaged, the box that is) which was true, I think this would last for a long time in my hobby DIY. Delivery by Amazon was fast, got it a day earlier than expected delivery time.
customer_reviews.author: Taibopeep

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, if you have a lot of money look for a better vise
customer_reviews.text: A good vise. Not the best, but probably a great value. Been using it for close to a year, just wish the handle was a bit thicker/longer/robust, wish it had a clamp for circular items. wish the lock down bars were a bit better designed, wish it felt a bit smoother when rotating. But again, I don't expect it to be a Swiss watch at this price. I'd probably buy it again. I might consider spending an extra $100 if I used this daily though
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Just a standard bench vice. Came nice and clean which is good because these sorts of things often come soaked in thick rust preventative oil
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Rusting after 2 days.
customer_reviews.text: This has been installed on my trailer for 2 days. It rained last night and all of the non powder coated portions are already orange and rusted. After 2 days and 1 rain. It works great but I doubt the metal holds up long seeing as it's already rusting. For the price it's fine and I'll just replace it with a better one when it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Yea its sweet. High quality. No burs or grease like the other guys said. But I did go ahead and use 5/16" bolts like the others recommended. I didn't even try the 3/8" bolts maybe they work. But I don't need that kind of anchor. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Underslinger

customer_reviews.title: Just go for it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after snapping a harbor fright one. This does look identical to the harbor freight one but I believe it is stronger as my tekton has seen way more use than my old HF. Very smooth in and out. Would not hesitate to buy again. Great value with a great warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy vise
customer_reviews.text: Good vise for medium to light duty. Throat depth is just enough to fit a magpul bev block.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Another good Tekton tool
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 4" vise that suddenly self destructed. It was many years old, but now is useless. I've purchased many Tekton tools and when their vise came up in my search I decided to go with Tekton. It seems to be well made and operates as a vise should. Only time will tell on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Mounting holes are NOT 3/8” as stated.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING- The description says that the 4-inch vise it takes 3/8” mounting bolts. But 3/8” bolts DO NOT fit in the mounting holes. You will need to use a smaller bolt, probably 5/16”.
customer_reviews.author: SteveC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vise to do small around the house stuff. I've mostly just used it to hold my lawn mower bladed while sharpening them. The vise moves in and out smoothly. It works as intended. I probably would upgrade to a larger, more robust vise if I was using this every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and was packaged well. Works great for home projects. I needed it for rifle assembly and it worked like a charm. It will come in handy for many future projects as well.
customer_reviews.author: C.G.

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze me
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today, and it appears very well made and should last for years. Installing it to my work bench was easy it comes with a template to help you drill the holes to mount it. Mounting bolts DO NOT come with this so you will need to purchase your own, I have drilled the holes in my bench and will be on my way tomorow to pick up some 3/8 bolts, washers & lock washers to secure it to my bench. I would classify this as a medium duty type of vise, for stuff I need to do around the house this is more than enough of a vise for me.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Great value, sturdy, looks good and delivered on time. You will need mounting hardware, 3 bolts, washer and nut or 3 lag bolts to anchor to whatever type of surface you are mounting to.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Snapped while clamping lead...
customer_reviews.text: Was clamping a chunk of lead using only my hands, no cheater bar. The 'neck' between the screw and the jaws on the dynamic side snapped off, leaving an extremely jagged edge. Sent an email to their support address, and never received a response.
customer_reviews.author: Datsun

customer_reviews.title: Great bench vice at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Solid build quality. The swivel capability is a huge bonus. Can not beat the price, it's better than the craftsman or the the kobalt vice I had, at 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy B

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent vice for the money, but after almost a year I did have an issue with the bolts that lock the swivel stripping out. I contacted Tekton, because it has a lifetime gurantee. Tekton requested a picture, and then sent me a new vice in less than a week. Great vice and great customer service. I would buy this again and future tools from Tekton.
customer_reviews.author: xis62000

customer_reviews.title: My first vice, excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a vice before, but wanted one for my workbench since many of my favorite youtubers use them a lot. I am new to tools and making stuff, so I did not want a $150 vice. This one works great for everything I need. It was easy to install and learn. It holds all the stuff great, and I am not worried about it breaking. I am also putting the anvil on the back to good use pounding rivets. This was an excellent $40 spent.
customer_reviews.author: James M, Colby

customer_reviews.title: Good Vise for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It isn't perfect, but it gets the job done. There are better units out there, but at this price I have no complaints. The box arrived crushed, but of course this is a heavy item.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pharr

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using it for general DIY purposes for 18 months. No issues at all. It’s probably not suited for a heavy duty use environment, but should be just fine for anything less.
customer_reviews.author: bmor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the light to medium duty work I needed ...
customer_reviews.text: solid vise, can't believe it shipped free considering how heavy it is. Have used it so far for holding metal stair balusters while I cut them down during intsall and for regripping golf clubs. Perfect for the light to medium duty work I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: WolfpackRaider

customer_reviews.title: Great Vise, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't beat this vise. It is not American made, but its very sturdy and has helped me fix and/or modify many different items. Tekton is a great company, and I have never had problems with warranty claims. You may need a high end vise for professional work, but for anyone else I'd save your money and purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyChrome

customer_reviews.title: Another Very Good Tekton Tool for a DIYer
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, this has been a good tool. I don't use it every day, but when I have needed it, the vice performed well and as expected.I'm a big fan of Tekton, and their prices, quality, warranty and customer service make them a value that is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Rusty out of box.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy! Seems like good quality, but came out of the box rusted. I've only used it a few times since and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Plutonium

customer_reviews.title: Vise
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and well packaged. No damage and arrived in a timely manor. No complaints and exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great vise!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, and there was no oil, as mentioned in some other comments. Easy to install and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: AFH

customer_reviews.title: Tough. I wish I would have gotten a bigger one. It probably would have held up a car.
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well after putting it through rigorous workout. Easy torque tightening. Good grips, strong tongue and haven't marked anvil after beating it with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: David P Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Nice Vice
customer_reviews.text: I needed a vice, and have been putting off buying one for quite some time. I have other Tekton tools and the price was right on this so I went ahead and bought it. No more laying 2 wrenches on the ground trying to get a nut loose and I don't shoot things across the garage when I'm grinding or wire brushing something. I also 'corner mounted' so I can swing it out of the way in my tiny garage.
customer_reviews.author: Herm Hilton Jr

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: looks nice but really has poor craftsmanship. If your not trying to do anything heavy or forceful you will prob be fine. I broke mine in half and was really not adding any crazy torque to it at all
customer_reviews.author: KrazyLady

customer_reviews.title: This is great
customer_reviews.text: This is just the right size easy to use amazing quality for the price. I'm a woman at the age of 64 and this is just the extra hand I need. I'm putting up ceramic tile in my daughter's kitchen just needed that extra hand while grinding works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Never have I seen a Vise break like this before,
customer_reviews.text: It truly would be a wonderful vise for a young boy as a first vise. I didn't know I was done this soon I only used it for about 30-35 days. What else can I say? Can I get a refund?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid-built vise. Easy to mount on a bench. Very satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Vise is very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on a piece of wood for portability and clamp it down on a strong wooden desk. Very good vise for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sep Jane Yu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Vise
customer_reviews.text: Really nice vise! My husband loves it and it swivels nicely! Easy mount
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Great little vice
customer_reviews.text: This vice is perfect for what little vice needs i have. Others have complained of theirs being covered in shmoo, mine wasn't at all. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: SECOND ONE BROKE
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE SECOND VICE WE HAVE GONE THROUGH. NOT A STURDY PRODUCT, UNLESS WE WERE SENT 2 DEFECTIVE ONES. I'M SURE WE ARE PAST THE RETURN CUT OFF BUT WE WILL NOT PURCHASE THIS AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Holds tight
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Holds tight, swivel action is smooth. Jaws open wide enough for all my small and medium size projects.
customer_reviews.author: Icon Green

customer_reviews.title: Who said 4 inches is to small.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little vice I got it from Amazon warehouse it's was still new in box with the protective plastic and grease still on it. This works for your basic needs as a home owner . This is not a hevy duty vice but it feels great and sturdy. I really like the swivel feature I have it on the corner of my work bench. I could turn in onto the bench or away depending what I am using it for or I could unbolt it to get it out of the way. The fit and finish are excellent I don't know how I went so long with out one. Great addition to the home workshop.
customer_reviews.author: JACK CORTEZ

customer_reviews.title: Good medium duty vise
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a back up vise for sharpening blades and holding metal to cut it. It is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Vise
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and meets my needs for light shop work. But would have preferred if they had included the required mounting bolts and washers. I had to make a run to hardware store to get. Used rubber gloves and "Greased Lightning" as solvent to remove the overall light surface grease.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G. Kukla

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy. Teeth area a little rough but may be the norm.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to do for the money. I did oil down the "stainless" parts as they developed some surface rust after a few days outside, hasn't been a problem since. The three hole mounting pattern is fine, just make sure you get the right size washers and 3/8 bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I love my new vise...
customer_reviews.text: but am sad that the price dropped eight dollars right after I ordered it...
customer_reviews.author: theresa

customer_reviews.title: could not be happier with this vice
customer_reviews.text: could not be happier with this vice. It is strong holds tight and square. The mouth opens wide as well. I use mine for gunsmithing and general shop vice work. www.gunsmith.us.com
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

customer_reviews.title: Good little vise
customer_reviews.text: Despite being covered in that packing grease to keep it from rusting this is a great little vise. I advise buying some jaw pads if working on material that can be marred though.
customer_reviews.author: MDutton

customer_reviews.title: Cowboy Dan, you wont find a better vice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great vice its about 15 lbs just what i needed, sharpening mower blades and anything else. Delivery was super fast seems to be made well time always tells. This vise is for my outside bench, so spray some wd on it and grease the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Hedy B.

customer_reviews.title: The third and very valuable hand in my workshop.
customer_reviews.text: I had a very similar vice that left when I moved. This vice is its replacement and does the job very well. It is mounted to a work table in my garage. I am very satisfied with it Good quality at a good price. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ed May

customer_reviews.title: heavy and solid
customer_reviews.text: packaging was damaged on arrival, but did not affect the vice. Seems to be a solid unit.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Fournier

product_meta.title: TEKTON 8-Inch Swivel Bench Vise | 54008
product_meta.description:
Size:8 in.

The all-purpose medium duty TEKTON 8 in. Swivel Bench Vise is the benchtop work horse your garage or shop can't live without. Whether you are repairing vehicles, metalworking, or assembling parts, you can work better, faster and safer knowing it is properly secured. Just lock it in and thread, fasten, build, bend, shape, or sharpen it with confidence. Made from 30,000 PSI cast iron, durability and dependability are built in. Put your project in the sure grip of the replaceable non-slip serrated steel jaws and it won't budge. For forming and shaping metal pieces, the polished anvil offers a smooth, consistent work surface. Rotate the vise around its 120-degree swivel base and you can position your work in just the right spot. Once there, dual lock-down nuts keep it in place. Turn the sliding T-bar handle and the jaw glides smoothly along the Acme-threaded main screw without binding or chattering, even as clamping pressure increases.

Specifications:

 * Material: Cast iron
 * Jaw opening: 7-3/8 in.
 * Throat depth: 3-7/8 in.
 * Anvil size: 5-1/2 in by 6 in.
 * Swivel: 120-degree
 * Tensile strength: 30,000 PSI
 * Weight: 77 lb.
 * Mounting holes (3): 1/2 in.
feature_bullets: Cast iron construction (30,000 PSI tensile strength) with replaceable serrated steel jaws holds work with a sure, nonslip grip
120-degree swivel base with dual lock-down nuts positions workpiece where you need it
Three mounting holes anchor vise securely to workbench
Polished steel anvil offers a smooth, consistent work surface for shaping metal pieces
Acme-threaded screw glides smoothly without binding
